results.title: 5000 Dumps
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley, Stuart Finley Productions and United States. Environmental Protection Agency
results.brief_description: A national survey of solid waste disposal practices revealed “problem” disposal areas. These sites contribute to air and water pollution, and are a health hazard. Visits some of the unsightly dumps throughout the U.S., and describes how they can be eliminated by citizen interest and Government action.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Finley, Stuart Finley Productions and United States. Environmental Protection Agency

results.title: 1976 kayak canoe Olympics. No. 10
results.brief_description: Part ten of a series which record the last three days of heats, repercharges and semi-finals of the 1976 Olympic Canoe and Kayak races in Montreal. Excellent for stroke analysis and coaching, as it includes slow motion close-ups of the best paddlers in the world. Photographed by Dr. Stan Plagenhoef.

results.title: The 1954 Redex trial
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch, Roland Litchfield and Litchfield Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Redex around Australia reliability car trial. The 9,600 mile route commenced at Sydney and passed through every Australian capital city. Only 124 of the 248 starters finished the 18-day trial. The film captures the atmosphere and illustrates conditions experienced by drivers in the trial as they drove through the rain, extremes of heat and cold, choking dust, across roads which in many places were rarely used bush tracks full of hazards to both car and their weary, strained drivers, who, at the same time had to be careful of secret controls to check their speed. Concluding sequences show arrival, welcome and presentation of the winner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Whitchurch, Roland Litchfield and Litchfield Productions

results.title: 80 channels under the sea
results.creator_credit: Max Lemon, Ted Holliday and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: Tells in simple terms, the story of the manufacture and laying of the first stage of the Commonwealth Pacific Cable across the Tasman Sea between Bondi and Auckland and the advantages that this new 80 channel coaxial submarine cable will bring: high quality, trouble free telephone, telegraph, telex-leased teleprinter, photo-telegraph and broadcast services between Australia, North America, Britain and Europe.

results.title: 50,000 Lives
results.creator_credit: Baltimore Fire Dept, Johnson and Johnson and M P O Productions
results.brief_description: The method and value of mouth to mouth resuscitation. Fifty thousand people die needlessly each year from asphyxia after an accident. This could be prevented by prompt application of mouth to mouth rescue breathing. Diagrams show why this method of resuscitation is so much more effective than others, and detailed demonstrations are given on live patients, adult and child. The use of a plastic airway is shown, and how to care for the patient as natural breathing commences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Baltimore Fire Dept, Johnson and Johnson and M P O Productions

results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.

results.title: Afterlife
results.creator_credit: Dean Francis, Justin Davies, AFTRS and Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent
results.brief_description:
A female flight attendant on a trans-pacific flight asks the question, “What would you do with the last five minutes of your life?” And sees it answered in the worst-case scenario.
Cast includes Lisa Hensley.

results.title: Athol Adams Collection
results.brief_description:
Athol Adams was a well known portrait photographer who documented his life in Dandenong in the 1950s. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

Athol was born 30/05/1916. He grew up in Box Hill, Victoria. Served in the RAAF in World War II in the area of reconnaissance where he commenced an interest in photography. Settled in Dandenong in the late 1940’s where he became a well known portrait photographer through until 1960, when he closed the business. He continued his profession as a photographer working for such companies as Volkswagen and Foodland. He was married to Carmen for 52 years, had four children, and was a loving husband and father.
